thread.title: Mets notes: Jacob deGrom gets the ball for Game 5 - Baseball
thread.title_full: Mets notes: Jacob deGrom gets the ball for Game 5 - Baseball - NorthJersey.com

author: MATT EHALT
title: Mets notes: Jacob deGrom gets the ball for Game 5 - Baseball
text:
NEW YORK — Game 5 starter Jacob deGrom warmed up in the fifth inning Tuesday in case the team claimed the lead and needed a bridge to Jeurys Familia, but he did not enter Game 4.
DeGrom will start Game 5 Thursday on five days’ rest against the Dodgers’ Zack Greinke.
NO MORE WORK: Matt Harvey will not be available in relief for Thursday’s elimination game.
Harvey made his lone postseason start in Game 3, and one of the reasons he started Monday was that he cannot pitch twice in this series.
The right-hander has never pitched in relief, but it’s customary in the playoffs for pitchers to be available, if possible, to throw an inning in relief.
Harvey is lined up to start one of the first three games of the NLCS, should the team make it that far. 
SAME LINEUP: Collins started the same eight position players Tuesday that he used in Monday’s 13-7 win, and that included Juan Lagares in center field.
Lagares starting meant Michael Cuddyer began the night on the bench against a lefty for the second straight night, and rookie Michael Conforto once again did not start against a lefty. Collins indicated he wanted to continue to use his players in the roles they are accustomed to.
"[Conforto] is going to be a very good player, and next year he’s going to be an everyday player," Collins said. "We had lineups that we were going to use against left-handers. We told them, ‘look, you guys are going to face righties, and you’re going to face lefties.’"
YOUTH MOVEMENT: Tuesday marked the fourth straight game in which the Mets’ starter had no playoff experience, and Collins has been impressed with how his pitchers have handled it.
"They’ve handled the pressure, they understand what the major leagues are all about, that these big stages are what you play for and what you develop to be able to handle," Collins said. "I salute the job of our minor league coaches and instructors have done to keep these guys’ heads on straight and not get too carried away with any situation."
BRIEFS: Noah Syndergaard was not available in relief for Tuesday’s game. Syndergaard threw 115 pitches in Saturday’s loss. … Monday’s Game 3 drew the largest television audience in the New York market for a Mets game since 2012, per TBS.
